text: [Music]
hello and welcome back to Cajun
curiosities in this video I'm going to
show how I remove and replace a tip on a
pool cue for a customer I'll also show
the process of conditioning the shaft so
sit back and watch as I go through all
the step first I'll go ahead and cut off
the old tip I'll do this probably about
a thousand rpms and just take my time
and take small thin curves
[Music]
good now that that's done I'm just gonna
scratch the face of the Pharaoh with
some 100 grit sandpaper and that way I
have some little scores in the face so
that the CA glue can hold on to here you
can see a hundred grit sandpaper and
it's time to sand the bottom of the tip
that's going to glue to the ferrule just
want to make sure it's flat and scored
next I'm going to use insecure medium CA
glue just a drop will do it and spread
it around just kind of work that tip
around and spread it so I have full
coverage hold it there for a second or
two and then press it against the
Pharaoh with my cross sled just pushed
up against it and tightened down let it
wait about five minutes you can see I'm
done pull it off and we're gonna go
ahead and cut this tip flush with the
ferrule it takes a number of passes you
want to take a little bit off at a time
and eventually I'll get the sandpaper
out here and round off the tip flush out
the sides I'll go through a number of
sandpaper grits starting with a hundred
going to 115 to twenty-four hundred six
hundred and a thousand and the finer
grit sandpaper I use here you can see
400 grit the finer grit I use the faster
I turn the lathe so you don't want to
put some really deep cuts in any of this
stuff basically I'm just lightly sanding
all this stuff you can see I just went
to the 600 and now I'm going to apply
with a thousand grit and I'm back up to
about 1,200 rpms now I want to put some
oil in the tip you always want to keep
your tips moist so I rub my hand up
against the tip and it's just the oils
of my hand and that holds the chalk on
it keeps the leather moist
just like a leather baseball glove you
put oil in it and throw a baseball in it
and wrap it up with rubber bands you
want to keep all kinds of leathers nice
and moist and oils the best just the
palm of your hand will work fine so here
I've got the tip looking fine and it's
time to go ahead and give the little
bonus that I give customers after I do
their tips I go ahead and condition
their shafts so I'll turn the steady
rest around grab the shaft cleaner you
see me here with and get some napkins
and just rub that shaft cleaner in there
turn the lathe on and let it spin also
and clean up the q chocks and the
different hand oils and stuff that
people get on their shafts and you see I
have a lathe spinning here
and just cleaning it with Shaff cleaner
I get this stuff from Q man billiards in
case you want to look that up and it
really cleans the shafts almost back to
the color of the wood remember I haven't
taken any of the finish off and here I'm
just smoothing the shaft out with
thousand grit sandpaper sponge and I'm
not even getting into the finish I mean
to tell you the truth there's there's
nothing coming off of this shaft I'm
just smoothing it out and making it
smooth like silk then you can see here I
have some wax also from Q man billiards
it's a Q wax and I put it on a rag be
careful when you're doing something like
this that the rag doesn't you know bunch
up and catch and you want to squeeze it
really tight if you can as tight as it
can start to burn your fingers because
you need to get that wax hot and almost
liquefied there you can see I'm burning
my fingers I'm holding on so tight and I
got it spinning pretty good I just
wanted to spread out evenly then I'll
change to a new part of the rag that's
dry and spread it out evenly hold it
really tight
try to get it really warm spreads out
nice and even and then you'll see me
move the rag again to another dry spot
and basically this is finishing up the
the shaft conditioning and it really is
it just slides like silk in your hand
you don't even need a pool cue club
after this
now there's a little wax on the barrel
right there where I could you know
spread it with the rag it builds up
there where where the steady rest here
is holding on so I'll just take up a
piece of t-shirt and just remove that
I'll turn the lathe on and hold it in
between my fingers and basically clean
it up well thanks for watching I hope
you enjoyed it and if you'd like to see
more videos like this come back to caves
and curiosities don't forget to like and
share thanks for watching and God bless
